meanings.definition: The plural form of the noun 'crow', referring to a large, black bird.
meanings.sent1: A group of crows flew across the sky, cawing loudly.
meanings.sent2: I saw many crows perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crow stole shiny objects to decorate its nest.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night was broken by the eerie cawing of the crows.
meanings.sent5: The farmer watched as the crows pecked at the corn in the field.

meanings.definition: The present tense of the verb 'crow', meaning to make the sound of a rooster.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the rooster crows to wake everyone up.
meanings.sent2: The sound of a crowing rooster echoed through the farm.
meanings.sent3: The little boy giggled as he tried to imitate the crow of a rooster.
meanings.sent4: The crow of the rooster signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The crow of the rooster was a familiar sound in the countryside.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'crow', meaning to boast or brag loudly.
meanings.sent1: He crows about his achievements to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent2: She always crows about how great her cooking skills are.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to crow like a rooster to show off.
meanings.sent4: His constant crowing about his success annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent5: The politician's crowing about his policies fell on deaf ears.
